reasoning: Ebstein anomaly is a rare congenital heart malformation involving the tricuspid valve. Reported incidence approximately 0.5 per 100k live births (1 in 20,000 births). Prevalence higher due to improved survival with modern cardiac management. Confidence moderate due to geographic variation and rarity.
source: Attenhofer Jost CH et al. (2007). Ebstein's anomaly. Circulation. 115(2):277-285
